content.raw: Here: #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1747/support-for-fixed-joints/diff#Ltest/integration/joint_get_force_torque.ccT163 ?

I briefly reviewed the `:*SimbodyState` methods, and I will probably just remove them from the class. 
I copied them because I implemented the `SimbodyFixedJoint` starting from a `SimbodyHingeJoint`, but 
actually this method will never do anything in a Weld mobilizer ( `getNumQ()` and `getNumU()` methods 
will always return 0 for it). Given this, I guess that the current implementation in `SimbodyJoint` (that 
does not do anything) is ok.
content.html: I briefly reviewed the :*SimbodyState methods, and I will probably just remove them from the class. I copied them because I implemented the SimbodyFixedJoint starting from a SimbodyHingeJoint, but actually this method will never do anything in a Weld mobilizer ( getNumQ() and getNumU() methods will always return 0 for it). Given this, I guess that the current implementation in SimbodyJoint (that does not do anything) is ok.

content.raw:
I updated the test, but this had the cost of slightly increasing the complexity of the PR: 
the provide_feedback option was not exposed in the msg::Joint (or I was not able to find it), 
so I had to use the SetProvideFeedback method. This method had several bugs, so I had to fix it [1]
before migrating the test. 

[1] : https://bitbucket.org/traversaro/gazebo-fork/commits/6f2565e82d8357ac3d364e5c2aa61bd239dbb1a2
content.html:
I updated the test, but this had the cost of slightly increasing the complexity of the PR: the provide_feedback option was not exposed in the msg::Joint (or I was not able to find it), so I had to use the SetProvideFeedback method. This method had several bugs, so I had to fix it [1] before migrating the test.

[1] : https://bitbucket.org/traversaro/gazebo-fork/commits/6f2565e82d8357ac3d364e5c2aa61bd239dbb1a2
